Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion thread

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces

Text:
Hi I have an using when using the Figma
When I disable the Chrome Hardware acceleration I am able to open the Figma without any issue albeit slower
But when I enable the chrome hardware acceleration setting everytime I open Figma my browser will flicker once and says that my browser did not support WEBGL
Is there anyway to fix it
I need to enable the hardware acceleration for other chrome features But then I wont be able to use Figma if I do so
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Is this happening on a specific file or all the files
If this is happening on a specific file then it might be possible the file has reached its memory limits
Figma is a browserbased app which means its subjected to a 2GB available memory limit that applies to each browser tab including those in our Desktop App When loading or editing Figma files nears or exceeds this memory limit it can cause performance issues like long load times or crashes
I recommend you to
Reduce the size of the file will usually help with load speed
Reduce the size of individual pages for example by splitting a page into multiple pages will usually help with rendering performance
Hidden layers loading and then hiding a large number of layers especially in components or with images stored in them can cause a high use of available memory on loading
Stacked Masks and Effects like shadows and blurs also take a lot of memory to load
You can find more tips in our Help Center article on how to Reduce memory usage in files that will help you to avoid hitting this limit again
If you are still running into issues despite these workflows you can reach out our support team so they can take a deeper a look into your issues here Hope it helps
Hi Celine_Doan
Its happening to all files actually
Which is weird since i can still access all files without issue if i turned the browser hardware acceleration off
i also tried using my other laptop with the hardware acceleration on to open all the files and it does not have the same issue
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Thank you for the details
Can you also ensure WebGL is enabled in Google Chrome The steps to do this are in this article 
If it is still doesnt fix your issue please reach out to the team by filling this form with all detail you recall WEBGL issue happening to all files affecting browser andor desktop etc here
Our technical team can investigate further Thank you
thanks Celine i followed the steps needed on the article and it still doesnt work
but ill fill the form you provided
Cheers

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks

FigJam is solving the problem of communicating about technical system layouts with people who are not accustomed to verbally processing such layouts

My only complaints about FigJam are very small the biggest of which is that I wish it were simpler to create multiple wire attachment points on one side of a shape using a snaptogrid alignment There are times when I need 4 discrete wires running into one side of a shape and I dont necessarily want them all going to the central point

Text:
Miro supports our team as a platform for digital collaboration  it facilitates hybrid work transitioning our information from the remote environment into the office and back
Having worked in mixed creative product and engineering teams I find Miro an effective tool for visual thinking and documentation The tools are accessible for newcomers to adopt but scale well for power users to leverage templates and tools that adapt to content and user needs across a project or workflows stages
Whether at the boardlevel or the teamlevel its up to individuals and their teams to manage board sprawl and keep things organized Depending on the information guidelines of your organization there may be some friction involved in ensuring that the right individuals are granted the correct level of access to certain types of content in a timely manner
Summary: Users find Figma valuable for replacing physical whiteboards in discovery and brainstorming sessions, as well as for teambuilding and engagement during meetings. It is user-friendly, intuitive, and compatible with other tools. However, some users face challenges with overlapping toolboxes and sharing options, especially for external or infrequent users.

Text:
Were a hybrid company and working in Product we often need to have collaborative sessions across teams where some members are remote and some are in person This is by far the best replacement for oldfashioned inperson whiteboarding with sticky notes and its even better because you can save it and easily access it later
Its been conducive to facilitating collaboration on designs whiteboarding brainstorming process reviews and strategy sessions Figjams design makes it easy to use for a wide variety of scenarios Weve used it asynchronously to prep for a discussion as well as simultaneously inmeeting as a way to accomplish inperson whiteboardingtype conversations especially when some participants are remote
The UI took a little getting used to and there was a short learning curve to figure out how to access different elements and add them to the page

Text:
Figjam has helped solve some of our collaboration problems with having a distributed and remote team Brainstorming and collaboration meetings that previously were done in person in a meeting room with whiteboards are now done using Figjam
Figjam is a great collaboration tool for brainstorming new ideas and recording different types of data in a consolidated space It has been great in helping to discuss and plan large projects by providing a single place where all the different aspects of the project can be stored and shared
There is actually very little that I dislike about Figjam It serves its purpose very well
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for its ability to develop processes in one place and share progress with colleagues and leadership, resulting in increased productivity. They find Miro intuitive, well-organized, and great for collaboration in hybrid environments, with visually appealing presentation tools. However, they suggest improvements in diagramming options, such as exporting diagrams directly to Visio or other flow tools for easier integration into external documentation.

Text:
After using the AI tool for a while I ran into some issues and also found some toolsplatforms suitable for lazy people
Lets read the conclusion first I recommend the poe_platform platform The supported bots are also quite rich There are no IP requirements and if you have advanced requirements you can directly subscribe on the Poe platform
ChatGPT 
Currently I mainly use Claudes robot on the Poe platform Heres a summary of the advantages Ive discovered
1 Responses will be faster than ChatGPT in Chinese conversations
2 The corpus will be updated in due course I dont know the frequency but at least he can help me sort out the relatively new content Layer2 and Starknet
3 Writing and copywriting skills seem to be stronger than ChatGPT subjective feeling
Lets take a look at other AI tool products in detail
1chatGPT
There are strict restrictions on IP and a global proxyprivacy window must be attached to it before it can be used
There are unstable situations For example I went to WeChat to send a message to him halfway through the conversation and when I came back I had to refresh the page before I could use it
There are occasional interruptions in answering so I need to remind him to continue
In the end he blocked me which is the biggest problem with using it so far 

2Google Bard Google fought back against OpenAIs products Currently I havent been able to experience them due to IP issues so I abandoned them according to the purpose of our lazy people According to feedback from some friends there is still a certain gap between product power and ChatGPT

3Claude
The founder is the former executive vice president of OpenAI This product is very popular in the investment community Its a bit like the capital that didnt invest in Tesla back then placed a heavy bet on Lucid
Its currently completely free to use and supports use of  on Poe and Slack
4Poe
This is an integrated platform made by Quora that supports mainstream AI conversation tools GPT4 and Claude paid subscriptions are also supported
Its the best toolplatform to use so far and you can use it without having to connect to a global agent or open a ladder

5BuddyGPT
This is a GPT robot on Telegram which will be more friendly to heavy TG users Theres a free version but it only supports 10 free messages per month and the subscription costs 599month

6Defalsh
Web3 content aggregation platform with GPT as the information processing engine
There is no need to register and you can use it with authorization through the Metamask wallet Although the introduction says Web3 content aggregation platform it doesnt seem to support onchain data retrieval yet so Im still looking forward to them becoming a Web3 onestop search engine
There seems to be a plan to issue NFTs in the future which is considered a crossborder product

7Notion AI
NotionHQs builtin AI function can help users automatically organize notes correct typos list article highlights translate create tables etc
Suitable for scenarios such as copywriting studying etc
There are free trials and the subscription costs 10month
Summary: The user is using the Notion AI platform for their personal project and is satisfied with the results. They are considering upgrading to the Notion AI platform for their business.

Text:
Up your gradient game 
Learn how to create this folded gradient effect with figma in just a few easy steps  no plugins needed
Ready Lets dive in 
sponsored 
Step 1
Create a new artboard and add a rectangle with a grey fill 
Step 2 
Go into vector edit mode and select 2 anchor points Manipulate those till you get an angle you like 
Step 3 
Repeat the first 2 steps and make sure to connect each begin of a fold with the end points of the previous one 
Step 4
Finish your composition make sure to create artboard copies for different iterations 
Step 5 
Time for some color Create a linear gradient going from light to dark and copy amp paste the style to your vectors OPTCMDC gt OPTCMDV 
Tip Use more than 2 color stops in your gradient for a unique look 
Step 6 
Nice Now we just have to change the gradient angles for every other vector to create more realistic lighting 
Step 7 
To take your gradient fold to the next level introduce some extra color combinations 
Bonus Step 
You can try to go for a top and bottom gradient effect as shown below 
Okay one more bonus step 
You can even try to split up a larger gradient in multiple stops to create an effect like shown below 
No matter what you do make sure to experiment and have fun 
Are you trying out this technique Make sure to share it by tagging figma and FonsMans See you at the next one
 Follow me FonsMans for more
 LikeRetweet this thread so more people can see it

Text:
I have created a Creative Hack workshop template which I use to help teams and clients come up with ideas 
Ill also use Miro for other team tasks in which multiple people need to make inputs 
Its helpful for capturing a large amount of information in a little amount time and ultimately making sense of those inputs
I describe Miro as an Adobe Illustrator Group Chat I love the drag and drop flexibility of it and ease of use which allows me to capture ideas and feedback in real time Even when Im working with large groups of people the tool enables me to synthesize conversations and sharebacks in a way that captures the essence of a meeting
I have a few small feedback options for Miro 
 
1 For some reason I am forced to put a password on a board when I make it publically editable It didnt used to be like this and I find it annoying that I have to do that every time I end up just saying miroboard for everything 
 
2 When I invite outside of my org participants to join a board Via the UX they often think they have to sign up to view the board which leads to time lost in the session correcting them and getting them to the board as a guest quickly 
 
3 Not sure if this is still the case but I wish I could give people outside of my team permission to lock objects I work across teams so sometimes Im unable to lock assets on colleagues boards and vice versa
Summary: Users appreciate the simplicity of Figma's whiteboard tool for organization and find it easy to use. However, they preferred the free plan and find connecting arrows in reverse to be tricky.

Text:
Collaborating can be challenging while working remotely but Miro makes it much easier to share ideas ideate brainstorm and create something together I use it every day to keep track of my tasks and to create conceptual designs before I work in Figma
I like the ease of use with Miro Its possible to collaborate with colleagues quickly My favorite feature is the Microsoft Teams integration With Miro and other whiteboarding tools we always had issues trying to share editing access on boards but now that we can embed the boards in Teams anyone on the call can have access and edit the board even if they arent an employee at our company It honestly has been a game changer for us when we do workshops or user interviews I also like the single sign on option It makes getting into Miro much easier and I dont have to enter my password 
 
I also love that you can take pictures of sticky notes in real life and upload them to Miro and they will turn into Miro stickies If the handwriting is hard to read then it might need to be corrected but this is still a cool feature
Theres not much I dont like about Miro My main frustration is that our company restricts our access and licenses to 3060 days and deletes our boards after 90 days of inactivity but I dont think thats a Miro policy just our company I do like the fact that you can download a file of the board and reupload it in case any boards get deleted
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for reducing paper waste and saving time, as well as enabling real-time collaboration for remote work. However, they experience slow performance on mobile devices and slow loading times on desktop boards.

Text:
We have used other platforms in the past with similar capabilities but FigJam is very easy to use It helps us diagram out our workflows and processes but internally and externally for clients The important thing is that someone outside of our organization that doesnt use FigJam every day can easily use it and collaborate
Being able to collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders is very easy The UI makes it easy to create and ideate our processes and sharing the FigJam with others is seamless They dont need to download anything to hop in and start editing
There isnt much I would say I dislike about FigJam There are some limitations in choices when building out flows such as shapes or colors but it hasnt effected me from being able to create what I need

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Text:
During workshops I mainly use it to brainstorm all together or one after the other as a desynchronized tool when we can not meet all together I encourage my team to input their ideas directly into Figjam and collaborate to organize the file as a comprehensive reference document for the future of the project
Figjam is a powerful tool for enhancing collaboration and idea visualization With its realtime collaboration feature and commenting system teamwork becomes effortless The file management system and template library are unparalleled among the competition making it a standout option
Multi account management and several workspaces can make the experience a bit difficult on the daily basis I often find myself lost searching for my current workspace
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's collaborative features, such as Figjam, which offers tools like whiteboards, mindmaps, and empathy mapping for efficient problem-solving. They also value the ability to comment on designs and receive feedback quickly. Figma is useful for UI design, prototyping, and testing, with powerful tools and community resources. However, the lack of offline functionality and a potentially steep learning curve for beginners are drawbacks.

Hi all
After the most recent update of Figma  Pushed a couple of days ago prototypes using Figmas nested component prototyping have been affected This has been cross checked on web links  alternative machines
This has new overwrites that arent included and are causing very concerning issues especially on components that use auto layouts This ultimately means if we hadnt complete a round of user testing a couple of weeks prior we would have some serious issues
Is anyone else getting anything similar
Thanks
Alex
Ive reported this issue a week ago still havent heard from Figma Ive send the form to the support team and link as dvaliao said so and nothing
Hey Adriana_DAguiar
Sorry to hear this We dont see any tickets in our system associated with the email address associated with your Forum account Did you use another email Do you have a ticket number Once we locate your ticket we can try to escalate it to the right team
Hello I did fill the form as you said and shared the file with the support team Ill do it again if its need it
Thats odd Thank you for letting us know We can now see your recent ticket 738343 and someone from our Technical Quality team will reply to you soon
Im in contact with the support team thanks

Text:
Making everything visual and allowing connection points helps team members see the larger picture Having the ability to create highlevel roadmaps helps to understand the strategy Other tech options MS Whiteboard Excel etc are available today but are not nearly as effective
I truly enjoy the collaborative nature of Miro The fact that everyone on my team can hop on and add content is super helpful It allows me to understand better where people are coming from and lets me draw literally correlations between ideas
One downside of using Miro is the licensing aspect It would be great if there were a way to have a less expensive licensed option for business that doesnt allow for all of the bells and whistles Many team members for example will stick to creating stickies and emojis and never use any templates or more advanced features
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's dynamic collaboration feature, which saves time by allowing simultaneous work on design and architecture. However, they express frustration with the inability to auto-arrange post-its evenly, especially within a box, and suggest improving this feature

Text: This review is more about Notion itself than the app After reviewing a bunch of other programs I subscribed to Notion to help build my new businesses internal infrastructure I was happy at first but it seems that the moment anything goes wrong Notion support is less than helpful Ive been going back and forth with Notion support trying to fix some billing issues updating my payment details Notion seems fairly incapable of actually troubleshooting the problem and at this point as I keep getting the same suggestions from different people Im convinced Notion help is running on AI and not an actual human with problem solving skills Despite numerous occasions saying the system wont let me update my payment details and suggesting an actual bug that may be causing the issues their reply was Its so easy you dont even have to log in Please update your information with this link Also to note you only get a reply every 24 hours so after every its so simple update your info communication gets a bit tiresome If youve seen Shs creek this whole exchange was the equivalent of just fold in the cheese  what do you mean  its easy you just fold in the cheese Ive tried to escalate this to a dept manager or someone in tech that would hopefully have the skills beyond its so easy just update your information however the more frustrated I get the less inclined they seem to be to help me Its at the point where Im considering switching to another service which will be a hard decision seeing as we have put a lot of time into building our systems in Notion Also to note despite being told that the old payment info is incorrect and I cannot update my payment details they continue to attempt to bill the old card number and then send me warnings that I need to update my information So let this be a cautionary tale for anyone using Notion for their business  its good until its not At which point you better be able to problem solve on your own Just fold in the cheese
Summary: User is frustrated with Notion support, as they are unable to update their payment details and are being billed for the old card number. They are considering switching to another service due to the time and effort they have invested in building their internal infrastructure in Notion.

Text:
How to turn an almost perfect UIUX to perfect
Using  as a perfect example created by cnnr_cllhn 
cnnr_cllhn LoseTheVery is a fantastic tool that finds a more concise adjective without using very Example very rich  affluent
The core idea is simple and the UI was chosen to reflect that Its straight to the point just like the Google Search homepage So whats the problem 
cnnr_cllhn  There are 3 main flaws
1 Site feels messy
2 Design lacks consistency
3 Elements feel a little too cramped
Well approach it via negativa style by removing stuff rather than adding
 Lets work on that that using figma
cnnr_cllhn figma 1 Decluttering 
The most important step would be to remove the clutter  the annoying newsletter popup the newsletter section and the newsletter banner Well get back to it later
This has already made a difference The interface looks significantly cleaner 
cnnr_cllhn figma 2 Let the design breathe 
Lets add more whitespace  the more the better This will achieve a better visual separation
Now the very  x  y line instantly grabs our attention 
cnnr_cllhn figma 3 Making buttons prettier 
Buttons look chaotic here randomly spaced different padding etc
Lets increase the font size adjust the padding and replace the word random with a dice icon Well also invert the third button

Text:
Im not saying this has actually happened yet still looking into it but beware when installing Wordpress plugins for AI products like ChatGPT  I installed a whole heap of plugins to see where they were at and then didnt use them for a month and this morning I got an email 
Received at 355am my time I was asleep and the email says it is triggered by usage limit I havent been using it 
Also I have been recovering from surgery and these usage records show usage that I am 100 certain didnt come from me because I installed those plugins prior to April 3 and the keys show last usage of 19 April Have obviously revoked
wordfence I think this might be for  
To clarify these are not plugins written by GPT but Repository plugins that offer AI writing assistance I wanted to test them out for something I am working on but it looks like one has gone rogue since 14 April
The only other thing I can think of is that NotionHQ might be doing API calls but I highly doubt That is the only thing I have installed on my machine but I havent connected with Make etc yet Anyway just a heads up to everyone to be very careful with these things  scammers

Text:
Miro helps us have one place for designs significant milestones and team collaboration It enables work globally and a quicker location to go back and find previous decisions and collaborations
Visual data sharing It is a great place to put pictures and ideas and map processes It is like having a visual management board in the traditional war room but digital so anyone can access it and it is saved Being able to use templates is also huge for getting teams started
It does not integrate well with some apps or display items Tables are still not ideal and it is often better to work in excel and copypaste your data into Miro Scaling can also be a little clunky where it can be harder to keep things visible at a high enough level but also readable when sharing sections 
 
The menus and controls are also not super intuitive It definitely takes time to bring new members up to speed
Summary: The user loves Figma for its ease of use and plugins for UI design, as it helps them develop software and websites. They appreciate the software's ability to create UI designs for iOS and Android Apps, but wish it had Photoshop-like options for creating things.

Text:
FigJam allows me and my team to quickly and easily make lowfidelity wireframes and conceptual designs as well as collect our findings from our user interviews and other Discovery activities
I love the ability to ideate and diagram in FigJam and then copy it to Figma to use as a reference and modify as necessary Its really great to use them in tandem I also find the shapes and arrows easy to use and connect The stickers are a fun feature as well 
 
The audio chat in Figjam and Figma is clutch My team will typically meet in there instead of scheduling a Teams meeting Its a great way to hop on review a design or ask questions about a specific thing 
 
I also really like the option to give anyone access for 24 hours This is great for collaborating with people that are not within the company
Theres nothing I dont like about FigJam I dont feel like there is anything missing from the application
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for enabling remote ideation sessions and asynchronous collaboration. They like the infinite space, autosave, PDF export, and its intuitiveness for occasional participants. However, they face issues with limited text box characters, undo functionality, presentation uploads losing resolution, lack of GIF support, inability to upload videos directly, and incompatibility with Visio maps.

Text:
Our iOS developers rely on PDF export in order to grab assets for mobile development Without being able to export PDF from slices it requires additional and tedious workarounds for how to export assets
Id like to request PDF export from slices
Its really a heartbreaker that exporting the slices to pdf is not available in Figma Sketch has it and it was working really great for us
Some of our multinational stakeholders whom we cannot insist to install or start an account for Figma or anything else as they rely on pdf documents for design review or sharing with internal team Sketch helped to convert the slices to pdf which was very light weight and compressible When we moved to figma the internal team as well few clients worked well with figma collaboration same we did with Sketch too and but the later ones didnt And now we are forced to go back to Sketch as we understand that its the app that we could rely to accomplish all our requirements
Thanks for the feedback Weve merged your topic with an existing feature request so we can measure interest from the community

Text:
Hi Im new to Figma and im currently struggling with this trouble
So Im trying to recreate the wwwpandaexpresscom website and im with the banner part
 
 
 
 
 
My steps are
Create the base structure
Group it
Duplicate it
Adjust the circle and image for second asset
Make it interactive from prototype tab
Create a component set
On the Design Frame i add the component and it went crazy with the line that dragged into the previous asset frame And when i present it none of my clicks works with the banner Ive cross checked the prototyped and Ive selected the on click
Can anyone please correct me on which step did I do wrong
Thankyou
Only link the two variants together within the component Dont also link the component or any of its variants to the instance of that component
Another thing might be the way you created the component Id make the two states first then make them both components then select them both and click Combine as variants in the right panel then prototype the variants together within the component
this solve my problem  thankyou very much

Text:
Hi all I am working on a Figma plugin that needs to import style from our team library Through research I think the way is to first use Figma REST API to get the keys of styles from our library file and the use figmaimportStyleByKeyAsync to import the style However the issue is this requires me to put my Access token in the plugin and I dont want to Is there a way for plugin to authenticate when making REST API calls on behalf of the person who uses the plugin
Or are there any other easier ways to importaccess styles from team library file in plugin Thanks a lot
You have several ways
Users will create their own personal access tokens which will be inserted into the input field of your plugin
Users will open the necessary library files run the plugin there to get the necessary keys return to another file to continue working
Hardcode the keys in the plugin
31 Or add these keys to for example a JSON file that you or anyone else can keep updating as needed

Hi thanks for the reply I see I will give option 3 a try to hard code the keys in the plugin and keep the plugin for internal use first The other ways seem to have some extra steps for people who uses plugin
Summary: Users are experiencing issues with Figma, where component instances do not update properly when there's a color change in main components. This issue can be temporarily fixed by changing the instance to a different variant and then reverting it back to its original form.

Text:
The ability to have a collaborative planning session or discovery session is the main reason I use the miro tool It makes it easy for everyone to visually see the flow of data as well
Miro makes complex discovery planning and process discussions into a simple collaborative tool allowing the full team to see and tell the same story The use cases for Miro are endless whether you are in the Project Product or Engineering space there are templates and activities at your fingertips aimed at collaboration
Sometimes connecting shapes together is buggy and more difficult than it should be I also wish there was a better way to connect Miro into powerpoint or another exported solution
Summary: Users find Miro easy to use with helpful features for diagramming and appreciate its diverse templates that support various use cases, including project management and feedback gathering. However, they mention the lack of integration with other services like Notion and the absence of screen reading capabilities for visual accessibility, which prevents their organization from adopting it more widely.

Text:
So Im trying to embed video files with alpha channels for a presentation I ran a test where I included a webm file over some live text I previewed it as a presentation and it worked perfectly I sent it to my manager to reveiw and when he looked at it the alpha channel was replaced w a black background and a white box around that content thatd previously been over transparency
Is Figma reencoding my file If so its doing it wrong If not why is the video changing after a period of time
I was told by a Figma rep that they dont plan on fixing this because safari doesnt support webm v9 w transparency This seems silly because thats only on mobile Also the issue is with figmas recompression of uploaded webm it works fine initially but breaks after they come in and incorrectly recompress properly encoded files Id prefer my files Not work on safari mobile rather than have them look wrong everywhere
Summary: User faced an issue with a dropdown menu in Figma, where it rapidly opened and closed during preview. Another user suggested that the issue might be due to the prototype getting stuck between opening and closing the overlay, and recommended using interactive components instead of the Overlay feature to fix the problem.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces

Text:
As the name already reveals our bootcamp is all about getting you into the action mode as soon as possible 
Instead of endlessly comparing tools
postponing to build
were diving right into building 
Here are 12 tools our alumni used for their MVPs  
Maybe you relate to this There are so many exciting NoCode tools around that its hard to choose 
You keep comparing them over and over again overthinking your ideas and needs
instead of actually getting started to build 
I definitely suffered from this myself before I joined in Oct 21
I was a longtime lurker before that following makers on Twitter and ProductHunt always reading and overthinking but never building 
They call this analysis paralysis
and its pretty annoying isnt it
ProductHunt Thats why we already made some of these choices for you for the bootcamp to get you into the action asap 
No need to compare and analyse everything first just follow along to get started 
Because youll learn the most from actually using the NoCode tools
ProductHunt The core program is designed around the 5 tools below
After learning how to use these youll be able to  Build a web app
 Build a mobile app
 Create a database
 Keep track of your projects
 Connect tools together
 And automate your work
All without writing code 
Adalo AdaloHQ
Design and build custom web amp mobile applications without code 
AdaloHQ Airtable airtable
Store and present your data easily
connect it to other tools and build apps on top  
AdaloHQ airtable Notion NotionHQ
Connected workspace to work better and faster
to keep track of all your NoCode projects

Text:
Miro solves the visualization problem for my clients by showing how my solutions I sell software work within their business models Using Miro goes beyond the presales process as it also helps to diagram implementation processes identifying the various technical and human aspects of the equation 
 
While words go a long way making a diagram and showing processes stepbystep make operations functional in my line of work Its also great to build business plans for teams as it allows everyone to collaborate without the hindrance of size limitations in a presentation or a document
Miro provides an allhands approach to workflow design where my team can not only collaborate and operate effectively but I can also work my way through various business marketing and sales demands 
 
From collaborations to creating operational plans to designing workflows and chat journeys for my clients Miro is an allencompassing tool to draganddrop design Its easy to use and intuitive giving users a simple approach to anything they desire to illustrate with predesigned templates that make working a breeze
Sometimes the scroll methodology can be a hassle specially when youre first starting to use it While it does impact usability perception its not as much as a hassle once you get the grip of how navigation works within Miro
Summary: Users appreciate FigJam for consolidating multiple tools, improving access across the company, and being intuitive for collaboration and brainstorming. Text:
When working remote as a product manager it can be tricky to get everyone on the same page FigJam allows everyone to share a single space and it truly feels like youre in the room together I have used it in situations as the sole driver while sharing my screen with the team to get a quick diagram or mind map put together and I have also used it collaboratively with my team as a digital whiteboard You can bring people into FigJam and have them collaborating within minutes whether they are familiar with the tech or not
Being able to join with several colleagues throw together a quick brainstorm and work quickly has been great I have used FigJam professionally to lay out calendar schedules run retros and run client workshops It is even valuable to go back to your data and organize everything into a visually consumable map This is a personal note but I even used FigJam with my wife who at the time was on a job away from our home to lay out our entire wedding floor plan and seating chart
The templates can feel a little daunting I often cant find exactly what I wanted or was looking for but usually a quick search online or asking colleagues leads me to finding a better template That or I just go through and make my own layout because its just that easy
Summary: Users find Miro helpful for facilitating and documenting collaboration across their team, particularly in remote settings. However, some users find the tool difficult to use and believe it's best suited for real-time collaboration.

Text:
10 tools I use every week as a product manager
1 asana 
This is our tool of choice when it comes to organizing work throughout the company
Simple but powerful it does everything we need to keep our teams organized and our work visible
2 MiroHQ 
Ive been using Miro for everything lately product briefs data analyses brainstorming mockups 
Its a tool that can do a ton of things well and helps make visuals much easier to consume vs a document
3 Looker
Weve used Looker for several years and its our goto spot for building reports and dashboards
Our core team dashboard and pricingconversion dashboards both live here and I check each daily
4 Amplitude_HQ 
For product analytics we use Amplitude Looker gives me highlevel business metrics Amplitude gives me the details
We use this for understanding the user behavior behind the metrics
5 CrazyEgg amp hotjar 
Two tools that do similar things we use one for our website and one for our app
These give us even more qualitative data behind our metrics with things like heat maps and screen recordings
6 SlackHQ 
I barely use email any more and while the Slack overload is real it does enable fast async communication among our teams wherever we are
Its also great for consolidating notifications from other tools Asana Google Docs etc if you set up the integrations
7 Officevibe 
Our HR team implemented this tool and as PM it gives me a bunch of metrics about how my team is doing
It gives me some data backing for how the team is feeling and shows me when I might need to spend time on morale
8 figma 
Miro is great for lofi prototypes and brainstorming but at some point it moves to Figma
This is where we build prototypes for user testing comment on designs and ultimately deliver the final spec to developers

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters

Text: Dont subscribe through an in app purchase Their product naming is misleading The Personal Pro is their free offering with limited ai requests 20 but through an in app purchase they will gladly sell you the same product for a 47 annual subscription Just like the free product it stops working at 20 ai requests Id say that this product without the ai feature is crap You can do better with any number of free products on the market Google docs etc And the product without the ai is free anyways so why offer an upgrade link when all you are doing is paying for something they offer for free Im angry but glad I subscribed through Apple there is a chance I can get a refund The ai is pretty good but I am wary at the shady deal they tried to pull over me Who know who else made the same mistake
Summary: User is unhappy with the product name and misleading subscription pricing, as the free version is limited to 20 requests and stops working after 20. They also mention that the ai feature is not as good as other free products, and the upgrade link is misleading. They are considering a refund and are wary of other users making the same mistake.

Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs

Text:
Being able to collaborate with colleagues in a virtual space is fundamental for remote working It has also made my research activities easier to manage and more accessible within the business From team building sessions retrospectives or working solo  it honestly is a game changer and I cant imagine how we would manage without it
I honestly cannot rate Miro highly enough It has become an essential part of remote working for me since I was introduced to it in 2020 and one of the most advanced whiteboard tools I have come across 
 
In my current role as a UX Researcher I use Miro for facilitating workshops and analysing and synthesising research I can dedicate an entire board to a research project and give stakeholders a space that they can refer back to at any time I also embed my project boards in our internal Confluence pages which allows my colleagues to interact with the board without having to leave the page 
 
Other features I find useful are 
 The vast amount of templates available 
 Giving presentations directly from Miro 
 The addition of a private mode 
 Show author on stickies 
 Im really excited to try the new talkback feature 
 
Its very intuitive to use so the barrier for entry is extremely low I often lead workshops with people that arent very technical and seldom have any issues with people trying to learn how to use Miros features
Exporting stickies to CSV format with the columns and rows in the correct order can be a bit fiddly I have to manually separate columns into rows whilst trying to maintain the integrity of the data Perhaps there could beis a way to tabulate stickies in bulk within Miro but I havent found an easy way to do this yet 
 
I often run out of sticky note colours and would really like to be able to use my own custom colours like you can with frames and shapes I would love some more themes for diagramming and flow charts or the ability to save a set of custom colours as a theme for diagramming shapes
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's seamless collaboration experience across multiple regions, especially for project kick-offs and workshops. Clients find it easy to use, and it helps display information in a more digestible way. However, some users find the membership and board access management confusing and suggest simplifying it.

Text:
Notion is an absolutely fantastic app for projects notes sorting and many many more due to its versatility and freedom As a single person notion is completely free with next to no restrictions Teams will require payment but it has a free trial to see how you like it and I consider it fantastic for groups However that being said mobile notion is severely lacking in certain features that the desktop version has Basic features like renaming your workspace can only be done on desktop There are also some bugs with the ui like the back arrow sometimes just straight up sending me out of the current workspace and the toolbar disappearing and requiring me to restart the app
These dont ruin the app by any means as notion is still an amazing app and is still amazing in mobile but I would consider mobile notion a great ADDITION to your desktop notion Use desktop as your main form of using notion when creating and use mobile when youre away from the desktop or need to check something Mobile as your only form of using notion isnt terrible but its definitely inferior
Notion overall is an amazing app with amazing developers who deserve lots of love and support They also gave major generosity with the app of which many other services wouldve charged the individual a large amount of money to use what notion gives for free which again is pretty much everything except very minor things like upload file size limits
Summary: User praises Notion for its versatility and freedom, but notes that mobile version lacks certain features and has bugs. They suggest using desktop as the main form of using Notion, and mobile as an addition to it.

Text:
cranked out 3600 word blog post today
HOW TO RESCUE YOUR FIGMA FILE FROM THE DEPTHS OF HELL AND LIVE TO TELL THE TALE 
silly but passionate title its about reducing memory usage
subscribe to my newsletter if you want to be notified when it drops  
this monster is so long because i committed to writing detailed step by step instructions
and its not some dinky 3 step deLeTE hIdDeN laYeRs
this thing is METICULOUS  i leave no one behind 
like if youre in Figmahell and youre googling how to get this file fixed the last thing you need is some bullshit SEOgaming glossover article with 3 steps explaining how to click on layers and delete them 
not on my blog nope
 how to make a wicked strategic action plan and target the most gnarly parts of your file first
 
 multiple plugins most are free you can leverage to speed up this work
whole post is designed to get you back to a safe amount of memory usage as quickly as possible
i spent all day on this and need to let it simmer and do a round of editing later but im really excited to put this out in the world first blog post of 2023 is 
shout out to gleb_sexy and sedatcak  youve each inspired and facilitated this post in a big way 
the editing hat is on  heres a teaser outline of this soontolaunch blog post
 Milestone 1 Develop a plan of attack
 Prepare your detective notes
 Find the highest concentration of layers
 cont
 Milestone 2 Reduce as many layers as possible
 Remove draft material
 Remove unnecessary hidden layers from regular frames
 Remove all unnecessary hidden layers from main components in your local file
 cont
 Milestone 3 Reduce variant count
 Introduce exposed nested instances
 Eliminate fauxrepeater properties in favor of using  content carriers
 Consider divesting from variants altogether 
 cont
 Milestone 4 Compress images 
 Leverage the Downsize plugin and ImageOptim
 Milestone 5 Simplify complex vectors
fin
i put a lot of thought into the order of these steps my hypothesis is this is the most effective order to gain back Figma file memory as quickly as possible
again my newsletter subscribers will be the first to know when I hit publish 
published 

looks like figma made some big enhancements to the resource use panel which is now memory usage

happy days 
ive also updated this blog post to match
Summary: Nothing

Text:

Text:
Hi all I am working on a Figma plugin that needs to import style from our team library Through research I think the way is to first use Figma REST API to get the keys of styles from our library file and the use figmaimportStyleByKeyAsync to import the style However the issue is this requires me to put my Access token in the plugin and I dont want to Is there a way for plugin to authenticate when making REST API calls on behalf of the person who uses the plugin
Or are there any other easier ways to importaccess styles from team library file in plugin Thanks a lot
You have several ways
Users will create their own personal access tokens which will be inserted into the input field of your plugin
Users will open the necessary library files run the plugin there to get the necessary keys return to another file to continue working
Hardcode the keys in the plugin
31 Or add these keys to for example a JSON file that you or anyone else can keep updating as needed

Text:
Continuing the discussion from Dynamic number of nested component instances
I have components that might include a number of instances of another component eg rows or columns in a table options in a selectdropdown etc To accomplish this I have to either create a separate variant for each potential number of nested instances or create the component with the maximum possible number of nested instances and make the instances hideable Neither is optimalthe first could lead to a crazy number of variants and the second could result in a large number of hidden layers which hits performance pretty hard
It would be great to be able to specify a component instance to be nested in a parent component then allow an arbitrary number of the nested child instances in instances of the parent component
Summary: User discovered a way to transform individual elements in Figma by selecting multiple objects and changing their pixel size in the right panel, similar to Illustrator's "transform each" option.

2 the list was
 declutter your environment
 prioritize your tasks

 learn to say no
 automate and delegate
 cultivate a minimalist mindset

and then i blocked time on my calendar to do the action items

Text:
Flexible platform for remote teams to work together on a visual level
As a user of FigJam I absolutely love the collaborative features of this tool Its so easy to share my FigJam boards with team members and work together in realtime no matter where we are located The interface is also really intuitive and userfriendly which makes it easy to get started with minimal training Another thing I love about FigJam is its versatility  I can use it for everything from brainstorming ideas to creating wireframes and user flows
It doesnt offer as many advanced design features as some other design tools on the market While its great for brainstorming and creating quick sketches or diagrams it may not be the best choice for more complex design work

collating many screenshots and adding notes Very useful for combining screenshots with diagrams text and offering more collaboration between viewers Fairly simple to pick up and use which is great It would be nice to have a start screen for a project to help the casual user
I use Miro for my individual work projects and to collaborate with teams For my own work Miro is great for collating screenshots creating diagrams and adding notes  commentaries The infinite canvas is great for just gettng started and getting ideas out For a team its very good for creating lightweight tables and timelines There are good tools for collaboration
I use Miro to collate and to share when Im driving the presentation Its less good for linear presentation You can create an ordering of canvases but I get worried about leaving a recipient of my link to Miro to find the first board and then go into presentation mode It would be nice to have a link to share that handles that so its easy to open and view linearly before getting to the full canvas view

Text:
Intro
There is an interesting concept in Figma thats used and was presented by multiple people and has different names Placeholder Slots Dummies Layout Blocks and so on
 Placeholder component is the base one
 Placeholder instances may be nested into another  Component
 Placeholder instances nested into  Component instances may be swapped with any other component instances
More details in this video by Adam_RuthendorfPrzewoski
The next step of its evolution is Layout Blocks by MrBiscuit
An issue
I have a base  Placeholder component
 Placeholder instances may be nested into other components  Column here
image2080384 854 KB
What I need is to nest a  Column instance into another  Column instance by swapping one of the  Placeholders
This is needed to customize Auto Layout spacings and other properties
image804564 843 KB
But when I try to do this I see an error message Failed to set component cycle detected
I totally understand why were not allowed to nest instances into their Main components  it will create an endless cycle such as infinite screen share
image1600808 102 KB
But actually it is not endless  we always will have the last one  Placeholder instance as a stop point
image804932 114 KB
My Demo file to better understand whats going on
Possible solutions
There are a couple of solutions that solve this issue but still are not optimal
Have multiple absolutely identical components to nest one into another
image15681242 223 KB
For the upperlevel use a component with more placeholders inside and hide unnecessary ones
image1092644 123 KB

I think the only solution for now is to create a  Main Container component with  slot instances inside Then you need to create also another component for  ColumnRow with variants With this you can upto 2nd level only Unless yo create a similar column component with different name
image1159633 365 KB

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind

Text:
Tutorial Thread 
Learn how to create this folded gradient effect with figma in just a few easy steps  no plugins needed
Ready Lets dive in 
sponsored 
Step 1
Create a new artboard and add a rectangle with a grey fill 
Step 2
Go into vector edit mode and select 2 anchor points Manipulate those till you get an angle you like 
Step 3
Repeat the first 2 steps and make sure to connect each begin of a fold with the end points of the previous one 
Step 4 
Step 5
Time for some color Create a linear gradient going from light to dark and copy amp paste the style to your vectors OPTCMDC gt OPTCMDV
Tip Use more than 2 color stops in your gradient for a unique look 
Step 6
Nice Now we just have to change the gradient angles for every other vector to create more realistic lighting 
Step 7
To take your gradient fold to the next level introduce some extra color combinations 
Bonus Step
You can try to go for a top and bottom gradient effect as shown below 
Okay one more bonus step
You can even try to split up a larger gradient in multiple stops to create an effect like shown below
No matter what you do make sure to experiment and have fun 
Are you trying out this technique Make sure to share it by tagging figma and FonsMans
See you at the next one

Text:
It solves the same problem as other whiteboard app does The fact it comes as part of Figma is a huge plus I might consider using something else if it was a big addon or wasnt part of the main platform There are better apps but the fact that this baked ina s part of Figma is the biggest reason I use it Its great that it allows me to quickly spin up a board and hammer out visual concepts quickly and Id happily use this to create UR artifacts but it has some drawbacks and I wouldnt be able to facilitate some activities
Figjam is a great tool that fulfills a lot of the functionality you get in more advanced whiteboard apps and does more or less a good job of it The ability to deeplink to elements in a board and make sections and postits is fine and works pretty well
There could be more functionality to format and resize postits Itd also be really helpful for the facilitation of workshop activities to be able to show and hide sections this would ideally be on a user or for users or user groups More mechanics like this which allows groups of participants and facilitators to work together would have a positive impact on running workshop activity withing the Figma platform and in FigJam
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for its collaborative features, time-saving templates, and ease of creating visually appealing charts and flows. They also enjoy using Miro for various agency tasks, such as information architecture creation and user experience workshops, due to its user-friendly interface. However, some users experience performance issues on low-end devices when using Chrome browser for large boards, suggesting potential room for performance optimization.

Text:
Im wondering if we are close enough to see a drastic shift in design tools moving away from the top bar sidebar canvas sidebar model Therere examples in this direction eg Play but thats like the other extreme Probably the sweet spot is in the somewhere in the middle
Hierarchy and organisation can maintain their association with the tree model but parts of the props can move to each and every pixel in the canvas
Another way to get inspired and think about this is looking at builders people who physically build stuff like roads gardens houses electrical installations etc There are certain patterns emerging like specialized tools big or small hacks when lacking the tools
They carry a bunch of general tools with them have extra tools nearby and focus on speed orand quality When in multiplayer mode each person has a specialized position or supports the main builder with orchestrated moves Their canvas is always messy to the eye
I think a way for figma to speed up Workflows especially as they want to onboard new users globally would be shortcuts for plugins and a clean up and redesign of all the helpful stuff added everywhere the last year Same idea for other design tools

Text:
FigJam helps fill the gap between collaborating and working remotely It allows our team to whiteboard together without being in the same room  and not lose value from doing so
FigJam is easy to jump into and get value out of even when unfamiliar with the tool The entire product team has found value in it for collaboration  from quick brainstorm sessions to workshops
I wish transferring things from FigJam over to an actual Figma file was easier I like to have the entire narrative of how a final design came to be within the Figma file the sessions on FigJam are part of that
Summary: Users find Figma convenient for remote collaboration and managing a large number of boards, as well as its integration with Microsoft Suits. However, they suggest improving the PDF and image export feature to maintain the board's appearance and make it easier to view large-scale work results.

Text:
Miro allows our distributed workforce to collaborate in realtime and keep an effective shared workspace that they can return to and use to continue developing ideas and opportunities Also the ability to adapt to the needs of each meeting and workshop are incredibly valuable
The collaboration element of the board The ongoing development and new features Miro continues to release The diversity of exercises or workshops that can be hosted in Miro The ability to enable hybrid or fully remote teams to collaborate effectively
For people who have not yet used an online whiteboarding tool the navigation and basic features might take a bit of getting used to However this can be overcome with some basic training or youtube videos
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's continuous development of new features, such as tags, sentiment-based clusters, and Miro AI, which help in organizing qualitative data for UX researchers. They enjoy the simple and intuitive interface, allowing for easy creation and organization of data from workshops. However, limitations in typography options hinder users from creating presentations that align with their company's identity, causing them to switch to other platforms.

Text:
The company I work at has little to no documentation regarding processes and strategy With Miro I can easily create the first draft of a diagramprocess and quickly add guests to collaborate and have a final version within 1 or 2 sessions of online collaboration 
Additionally Miro has helped me shift my problemsolving methodology from pen and paper and prose to visually abstracting the problem in a way that is easier and more efficient for my brain to process
The tools ease of use the number and diversity of templates and the resources available for support Creating visually stunning yet simple graphics is incredibly easy As I began to use Miro more and more frequently in my workflow my way of thinking and solving problems has shifted to be more visual  I am able to abstract my problems and express them on the screen in a powerful way
I wish Miro had better tools to create modify and import vector graphics With its current set of tools its cumbersome to create vector graphics and text that would take seconds to make with the right set of tools
Summary: The user appreciates Figma's collaborative features and free layer for small teams, which helps in conducting retrospectives and discussing strategies. However, they find the limitation of three boards and the need to pay for certain components restrictive.

Text:
How might we collaborate efficiently in a hybrid work environment 
 
Workshopping within miro means people can participate in workshops remotely regardless of where they are in the planet This has also meant that travelling for workshops has become less important  saving the business money
Obviously the pandemic force a lot of us to find new ways to collaborate and connect without being face to face Miro was clearly ahead of the game in this regard But even since were seeing more of each other in the flesh miro still seems to be adding value with how easy it ease to document workshops quickly capture ideas and bring people together to brainstorm
There are very few things to dislike about miro There are some very minor things like how tables not being incredibly userfriendly limitations in how you can modify shapes particularly for the sake of creating wireframes But all in all this stuff is nice to have and the fact that you can even do basic wire framing along side everything else that you can do is a win
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's ability to align remote meeting participants and create engaging, self-documenting workshops. The speed and fluidity of the application enhance the facilitator experience. However, the licensing model and board structure can be confusing for infrequent collaborators, and users suggest improving security by including the entire enterprise as users and charging only for power users.
