Text:
Its the goto design tool in our team It responds to all wireframing prototyping and design requirements and facilitates team collaboration It also comes with Figjam and eliminates need for other whiteboarding tools
Its easy to get started with Figma and its robust community means there are tons of resources and plugins to inspire and help speed up your design process and there are some incredible plugins out there
There isnt much to dislike but there are a few inconveniences First everything is online so you need a strong internet connection especially when dealing with large files Second the way plugins are handled can feel a bit clunky you have to look for it saverun it and it opens as a separate window  wish there was a way to anchor it Third it might just be me but I always get confused navigating within the community section but again these are just minor inconveniences and the pros far outweigh the cons
Summary: User appreciates Figma's seamless screen creation and cloud collaboration features, but requests an increase in the number of pages available in the free version.

Text:
The ability to quickly collaborate on user flows and audit our product with nondesigners has been made super quick with the use of FigJam We are also utilizing FigJam for sprint retros which allows other roles to become power users of FigJam benefitting our team using the tool for different purposes and not having another learning curve
I like the speed at which I can collaborate with my teammates for a variety of topics I spend most of my time using the timer for timebox ceratin conversations around audit and design decisions which we use FigJam for Additionally creating user flows within FigJam has been tremendously helpful
Currently while components are available within FigJam there isnt an easy way to visibly pull in the components without copying them over from a design file Additionally if I want to scale components Ive copied into a FigJam they can not be manipulated and thus I spend more time jumping back and forth through files rather than having a focused conversation around reviewfeedback within FigJam
Summary: The user finds Figma relatively user-friendly with a manageable learning curve and appreciates its ability to visually show ideas and thought processes using various mapping tools. However, they find it lacking in aligning formats for creating visually appealing or structured pictures and graphs, requiring manual adjustments.

Text:
Miro is always working on new features that help me as a UX Rersearcher to find new methods of organizing qualitative data for example with Tags or the new clusters by Sentiment or keywords among other features through Miro AI which despite still being in an early stage are very promising
I like the simple and intuitive interface that allows me to start creating right away with sticky notes or a mind map and progressively develop my work I am very happy with the new features that come out I always end up using the tags in the sticky notes the creation of clusters and everything that can help me organize a lot of qualitative data from workshops
The limitations in terms of typography when I want to present data directly in Miro but I cant create presentations according to the companys identity is something that makes me have to move to other platforms which is a shame because it works relatively well the part of creating interactive presentations
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's collaboration capabilities, especially for remote workers, and its user-friendly interface with a wide range of templates. However, they suggest including more default shapes, such as those for Value Stream Mapping, to enhance its functionality.

Text:
FigJam fills the role of a handful of tools we were previously using across the business We were able to consolidate and say this is the true approved tool across the company Its helped teams align and ensure access across the company via single sign on The access issues we had previously with InVisionFreehand Miro etc are long gone No more requesting to view or edit access
Anyone can get in there and start using it Its pretty intuitive and we use it all the time across many teams to collaborate brainstorm plan whiteboard etc We also switched to using FigJam for all team retros in the company All the templates timer stickers music and more make FigJam fun to use  but not in a way that distracts from the work
I dont dislike the tool at all I will say one pain point we ran into is that there currently isnt a way to use stickies while maintaining anonymity Anyone can go click an icon to toggle the original authors name off and on to see who said it  not ideal for retros BUT our account rep taught us to switch to shapes and we no longer have this problem Would be nice to have a retro setting on a FigJam that would preserve the psychological safety of team members We feel extremely supported by our awesome account rep
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's ease of use for remote workshops, efficient documentation, and reusability of materials. They find the drag-and-drop feature helpful for structuring brainstorming sessions and enjoy the useful templates. However, they suggest adding a feature to transfer content to MS PowerPoint for presentations and incorporating auto-correction on Post-its.

Text:
Miro helps me create a mindmap for a product share it with clients and other stakeholders get feedback and work collaboratively Miro also allows me to make the initial sketch for a product to give the clients a basic flow of the product so we can solve the problems before the development and keep the product consistent this also helps in efficiency and reducing costs
The upside of Miro is brainstorming can be done collaboratively with all the stakeholders including clients this helps in coming up with solutions quickly and even testing out the ideas in the initial stages of development
Miro is a good app overall but it can sometimes be overwhelming and cluttered Miro cannot be used offline Navigating on a larger gets a little tedious and occasionally inaccurate lags at times
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's collaborative features for gaining consensus among product team members and its ability to replace conference room whiteboards. However, they face challenges with importing Excel tables and HTML content and desire more robust editing options for post-it note styles.

Text:
1 It would be easier for all native Spanish speakers to use and understand By having the interface and content in our native language it would be easier for us to understand the application and use all its functions correctly
2 It would increase our efficiency at work By not having to constantly translate terms and concepts into Spanish it would save us time and allow us to be more efficient at work
3 We would feel more comfortable If Spanish is our main language it would be more comfortable for us to use the application in our native language
4 It would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in Spanish Using Notion in Spanish would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in our language which can be especially useful if we are working in a Spanishspeaking business environment
5 It would make us feel included and valued By having the option to use Notion in Spanish we feel included and valued as users of the application which would increase our satisfaction and loyalty to it
Summary: User suggests adding Spanish language support to Notion, as it would be easier for Spanish-speaking users to use and understand, increase efficiency at work, and make them feel more comfortable. They also suggest learning new technical and business terms in Spanish, which would be useful in a Spanish-speaking business environment.

Text:
FigJam is kind of my onestop shop for pretty much my entire research process I use FigJam to plan studies in it with my stakeholders take notes during user interviews affinity diagram user insights create final deliverables prioritize customer feedback etc It would be much harder to do these things without FigJam
FigJam makes collaboration with my project stakeholders engaging easy and fun Its approachable and usable regardless of ones tech savvy FigJam also allows me to perform critical UXR tasks like affinity diagramming in an efficient and visually pleasing manner I rely heavily on FigJam in my daytoday work and create almost all of my deliverables in it
Some things in Figjam could be made more efficient I mainly run into issues with formatting For example you cant easily paste Excel rows into it I also wish you could edit text without having to perform multiple clicks to move through layers in the file eg two clicks to edit text in a sticky I understand why this exists but it would also speed up my work process Resizing things can also get weird sometimes eg highlighting some design assets and trying to make them bigger only expands certain elements have to manually fix
Summary: User appreciates the visual design and prototyping features of Figma, as well as the community support and animation capabilities. They suggest adding a few more helpful features, such as repeat grid and a few others.

I recently obtained my certification from your platform and while I appreciate the knowledge and skills I gained from the experience I believe its time for a change in your testing methods
NotionHQ Were in 2023 and your current questionandanswer format feels outdated With the vast resources available to us online including Google Notion docs and ChatGPT its unnecessary to rely solely on memorization and rote learning
NotionHQ I suggest implementing a challenge or projectbased approach to make the tests more engaging and interesting Spending an hour answering questions only to fall short of the 70 passing mark feels like a waste of time and time is a valuable commodity for everyone

Text:
People often ask me for good examples of executive communication lets talk about joshm the CEO of browsercompany 
And the intelligent and underrated use of YouTube for a business 
Its particularity He chose as a social network to express himself YouTube Uncommon
Concretely browsercompany has a channel with 20k subscribers and 2 types of videos
 the culture and vision of the company
 tutorials and advice for its users
 
We will mainly focus on the first category the one in which joshm is personally involved
In terms of form these videos are YouTubefriendly that is to say
 exclusive no balanced body videos on all channels
 1020 minutes
 with a chapter
There are 2 formats that I particularly like
1 its QA in early 2023 to report and answer for example the question of its business model with embedded graphs and dataviz 72k views 3rd channel video
 
What is interesting is that this video starts from a tweet that he posted in early December just before the 2nd meeting of the browsercompany board with the desire to be transparent and accountable to his users build in public

And hey presto 2 weeks later he answers it in this famous video

2 A video where he films himself in a photo booth from his Mac desktop which allows him to browse his Finder and show content images sounds videos etc by unfolding his story Funny with a touch of brothelartisan
 
This format was called videofile_ and allows browsercompany to tell its new features and the philosophy behind each time being embodied by an employee not just the CEO And given the engagement rates thats interesting 
2 other videos that were a hit  a metavideo where the CEO watches and reacts to a review of his browser by one of the biggest tech influencers MKBHD Its THE most popular video with 343K views Skilled at surfing on his visibility

 a vlog with members of the browsercompany board who clearly plays the behindthescenes strategicmeetingsthatnotsoseetosee card the kind of content that always works

Text: This app worked fine as a free user however after becoming a subscribed member I ran into some annoying and suspicious issues I wanted to utilize the AI to see where the limits were and then to eventually use it for academic and creative purposes Of course theres a limit to free uses so I subscribed to a month to see how often I would have to use this and if it was really worth paying for longer I paid 499 for the one month subscription but it wont actually let me use the AI and instead tells me that I need to subscribe but I already have The receipt is in my email as proof that I did pay My app says I am a subscribed member so why is it denying me member benefits I have tried many things to fix this including restarting my phone restarting the app deleting and downloading the app again logging out and then back in etc Nothing has worked so far Not only do I feel robbed but it almost feels intentional because when I tried to use the AI before paying for a subscription I would only get a message saying that I have run out of free uses but after subscribing it sends me straight to the subscription choice page That gives the impression that the app is purposely not letting me use the AI program even though I have paid for it regardless of if that is actually the case or not Looking through some of the other lower reviews I am not the only one who has ran into this problem Please fix this because it is frustrating to not be able to use what I paid for Summary I paid for premium but the app isnt letting me actually use premium benefits Thank you Frustrated Notion User
Summary: User experienced issues with the app after subscribing, as it would not allow them to use the AI program. They tried various solutions, but none worked. They feel robbed and suspect intentional behavior on the app's part.

To Collaborate with Others

Text:
Helps to visually explain complex systems in a simple way Provides value to our consultancy
FigJams simplicity and ease of use enables fast mapping and sharing of complex systems and dependencies Ive recently created several sprawling figjam charts that outline marketing programs from beginning to end for our clients They have been so helpful keeping the team informed at a high level and are a great reference to regularly huddle around 
 
This is just one kind of use  because of its flexibility you can begin to discover ways to think and present ideas large or small Create fast design mockups review and provide feedback on designs create storyboards  the list can go on and on Easily shareable to anyone with little to no trouble with login attempts or dealing with incompatible file types 
 
It feels so freeing to break from the clunky confines of a ppt slide with its bad clip art and boring bullet points Expanding across an endless canvas allows us to combat any confusion or anxiety that tends to show up around building complex marketing campaigns 
 
Figjam has become one the most valuable tools in my arsenal and is one of the best Ive seen after almost 2 decades of working with these types of apps 
 
Highly recommended
Cant think of any at the moment I need to spend more time exploring all the templates to expand my usage
Summary: Users find Figma easy to use for collaboration between design and development teams, and appreciate its features for creating design systems, libraries, and reusable projects. They suggest adding tutorials and help guidelines for further assistance.

Text:
Miro has become our virtual office since we started telecommuting It has been the best choice for us 
 
We use Miro to exchange ideas visualize data in userfriendly formats and plan some processes
Miro excellently simulates a whiteboard to create a virtual space that I really like I can hardly feel the difference between this software and the whiteboard I have in my office 
 
Thus the platform has become an ideal virtual office for realtime collaboration

A little bit about us Why SecondBrain Inside thread 
SecondBrain is a concept that is booming recently given the boom in creating second digital brains For this reason we want to get closer to the Spanishspeaking community and create a community around productividad and herramientas digitales
But what are second digital brains They are tools that allow you to manage and organize your information thoughts and tasks Theyre like an extension of your brain allowing you to store and retrieve information efficiently
Examples of second digital brains are Evernote Notion Trello and Todoist These tools allow you to create notes todo lists and projects in an efficient and organized way We are specialized in NotionHQ but we will not leave out other solutions

Hi there

Text:
I really love nested instance properties feature but it works for one component instance only It would be useful if nested instance properties were available when I select several parent instances
My example
Component structure
component Label  used for different statuses  has text property Label for text inside 2 component Table Cell  used for building tables  has variants for different types of cells
Case I create column of statuses in the table it includes cells which include label If I want to update text in one label I can use nested labels text property But when I want to update text in several cells nested instance property disappears and I need to select label instead of cells or use some plugin for bulk text update
PS thanks to figma team for your incredible work I would also love to see support for this

Text:
Our team likes to use Figjam primarily because its provided by Figma We use Figma for design anyway so its handy to have Figma provide an internal whiteboardingcollaboration tool without us having to create account  learn another platform
What I like about Figjam is that its easy to use and provides some templates with instructions so that teams can get onboarded quickly and start collaborating Ive used Figjam with other designers and also with nondesigntech team members and weve benefitted tremendously from using Figjam as a fun collaboration tool
While I like that Figjam provides basic tools for brainstorming and realtime collaboration I sometimes find it can be too limiting I wish there were more customization options related to shapes colours and fonts so that my teammates and I can explore crude wireframes that are just a little more detailed than the rounded rectangles and other shapes that Figjam allows When the project moves to that stage I end up moving to regular Figma and using the comment functionality there or if its difficult to manage access create shapes in a Figma file then copypaste into Figjam which can be tedious
Summary: Users appreciate Figjam for its ability to organize ideas in an aesthetically pleasing way and facilitate collaboration with colleagues. They enjoy the customization tools and design features, but would like to see some Figma functions, such as saving an image, integrated into Figjam.

The User finds Miro to be an incredibly powerful tool for collaborating with teams, due to its easy-to-use interface and real-time collaboration features. Additionally, the platform's extensive range of features are highly customizable, allowing for greater flexibility when working on projects. Users may find the pricing structure of Miro to be expensive for smaller teams or individuals, and the extensive range of features can be overwhelming for new users. However, Miro provides helpful support resources such as video tutorials and a user community to help users get up to speed quickly.

Text:
Today I want to give some insights into the TOOLS that we use at our agency that works with startups from around the world including Silicon Valley
Giveaway at the end 
212 First up we use NotionHQ  Its our hub for everything Tasks deadlines management  its all there It works like a charm to keep everything organised especially when working when a team its nice since everyone knows whats where
312 Next Slack We use this mainly for internal communication with the team and for communication with a few clients In the beginning we wanted to use Slack 100 for clients communication but some clients just dont like it and we dont want to force them haha
412 We also use Monday its our CRM where we track leads and conversions basically keeping our clients in the loop We used to do this in Notion but it was hard to use which made it less motivating to keep it up to date
512 zapier is our goto for automation It takes care of all the repeat stuff so we have more time to be creative Nothing special but is saves a lot of time
612 For crafting copy we use OpenAIs ChatGPT Before GPT released we were actually using a tool called Jasper a year ago it was around 100USD a month and delivered 30 of the results GPT offers for free a real game changer
712 webflow is the platform we use to built our website with which integrates seamlessly with all our other tools through Zapier
812 For designs were all about figma from UI designs to logos its our goto for making visuals
Summary: User shares their plan to write a case study on their personal website, showcasing their design ideas and implementation process. They mention using Figma, Webflow, and custom JS for designing and developing the website, which took about two months to complete.

As the title suggests the word Notion also comes out of notions

The integration is also good Magic keyboard Bluetooth keyboard Bluetooth mouse wired mouse etc its all very compatible but I dont know why the reviews are critical theres no Zanrek Even though its an iPad Pro the app doesnt seem to require high specs at all but Zanrek is a compatibility issue so its nice that its very easy to access even for beginners Notion team fighting

Text:
MIRO helps me manage a project schedule with complex deliverables timeline swimlane owners and key crossfunctional dependencies It also helps with basic product roadmap and innovation planning The visual appeal is also helpful as it can serve as a presentation board for senior management presentations
MIRO is an ideal tool for facilitating collaboration across teams or large groups I use it with my teams for a variety of applications including planning project schedules brainstorming ideas mapping out solutions and process flow diagrams It is highly flexible allowing the user to define the structure and content I really like the ease of use and the infinite space which allows you to constantly be adding to existing boards There are many existing templates that help provide a good starting point for collaboration
One of the challenges that weve seen is integration with other software Id like to see a more seamless integration with MS Excelfor instance the ability to capture live Excel spreadsheets in MIRO that are autoupdates as the underlying Excel sheet changes
Summary: The user appreciates the collaboration features of Miro, which allow team members to work together regardless of location. They also appreciate the digital whiteboard, which allows teams to capture ideas, organize information, and make decisions in real-time. The user finds the tool easy to use and appreciates the zoom in/zoom out feature. However, they find it challenging to use from mobile internet due to the high-speed internet requirement.

Text:
Hi there I am currently laying the foundations for a Design Language System At the same time another team is working on the first of a series of Apps My intention is to take the components that they create for that first app and then add them to the design system so we can reuse elements for all the future Apps
The DLS and the the first App will be created as two separate design files within the same project My hope was that at various intervals I would be able to copy and paste content from the App into the DLS then publish the library from the DLS and get the other team to use the library swap feature to swap their local components with those from the DLS published library
But my initial tests lead me to believe that this isnt possible It seems that you can only use library swap on two externally published libraries rather than an external library the DLS and a local library the App Is this the case
If so what is the suggested workflow in this situation
Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated Many thanks
This topic was automatically closed after 30 days New replies are no longer allowed

Text:
When we need a meeting we always decide to use Miro And this is a standard in our way of working even if we are all in the same room The reason is that Miro has been instrumental in brainstorming until we reach agreements that we all like The methodology has made the meetings less timeconsuming and more effective
The fluidity of the application is out of this world Thanks to it we can create structures while meeting without waiting for changes In addition its easy to use so anyone can master it and get a lot out of it to express their ideas
Miro works perfectly thanks to the fact that it is online but this is a drawback if the connection is unstable Therefore I would like some measures so that the unstable connection does not affect the experience so much

Text:
It allows me to put all the pieces of my project in one place so nothing gets lost When you have an evolving project with research and numerous iterations it helps to be able to see all the info in one place and makes it easier for others to understand the full picture 
 
I also use miro to share out work and do critiques It is easy to have collaborators follow me on the board while I am presenting I will generally share my screen while presenting but it can be hard to see small details so having others in the board helps with this There are comment and sticky notes available for peers to leave feedback too
The board is endless and I can fill it with as much content as I want There is a timer and you can set yourself to be followed around the board which makes critiques easier It is extremely easy to add arrow connections Overall its simple and easy to use
Miro has cool features that are somewhat hidden so I didnt realize they existed for awhile Because boards can fill up easily it helps to share a link for a frame directly and it can be done but its hidden behind a meatball menu There are stickers which come in handy but are hidden behind a plus on the sidebar
Summary: User loves Miro for its simplicity, ease of use, and self-explanatory shortcuts for brainstorming and sharing ideas. They appreciate the ability to sketch and create retro presentations, but find it difficult to zoom in and out and have multiple users on the same presentation spot.

Text:
Miro provides an ideal software solution for collecting comments and feedback on wireframe designs showing what they would look like with elements rearranged and sharing them with others we are collaborating with

Easier to navigate than visio
Doesnt have BPMN symbols and swimlane structure where space can easily be added in the middle of a diagram so not well suited for process mapping  I still use visio for that

Text:
Project time line and deliverables The Miro board captures deliverables per stakeholder and when setting up the expectations The timeline is also important for project reach and target goals 
The flexibility allows collaborative input effort etc on processes we are not aware of
Accessible and easy to use Easy for collaboration 
Can track changes and revert changes by looking through history 
Many pathways to build a project from start to finish and a way to organize strategy
Large Miro boards may take time to load Slow page upload would display a blurry board 
Comments are timestamped and call callout stakeholders 
Some setup are not locked so some users may unintentionally move the setup
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's collaborative platform, which allows teams to work on ideas creatively and efficiently without needing to be present simultaneously. They particularly enjoy the group collaboration features and the visual aspect of the tool. However, some users find navigating the boards to be slightly challenging and require a mindset adjustment.

Text:
Team collaboration brainstorming idea consolidation timeline and roadmap creation documentation of ideation and feedback easy collaboration with internal and external parties
I have been using Miro on and off for roughly 3 years now and I always find myself gravitating to it Whether internal meetings or external meetings with clients the tool is valuable for conducting whiteboarding sessions brainstorming ideas and overall collaborating with larger teams I have also used it for project retrospectives creating timelines and wireframing dashboards It is userfriendly and has every connectioncapability I can think of
I honestly cant think of anything The connections are great the interface is sleek and the application as a whole is very userfriendly Maybe optimizing mouse scrolls for easier navigation within a board But even that is very smooth asis
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's ease of collaboration, flexibility, and smooth scrolling and zooming features. However, they find the wireframe library's icons to be minimal and have difficulty changing colors in IconFinder. Additionally, they experience issues with note-taking, such as lack of spell check and challenges in managing layer ordering.

Summary: The User is benefiting from the product by being able to collate many screenshots and add notes, which allows for more collaboration between viewers. It is also easy to pick up and use, although a start screen for a project would be beneficial for casual users. The User enjoys using Miro for individual work projects and team collaboration. They appreciate the infinite canvas for getting ideas out, as well as the tools for creating lightweight tables and timelines. The User also finds the collaboration tools to be very good. The User finds Miro useful for collating and sharing information, but not as good for linear presentations. They would like a link to share that makes it easier to open and view the information linearly before getting to the full canvas view.

Text:
Miro solves several problems for product managers including collaboration ideation and brainstorming project management prototyping and remote work It provides a centralized platform for product managers to collaborate with their team members and stakeholders regardless of their location Miros digital whiteboard allows product managers to brainstorm and ideate with their team visually organize their ideas and prioritize their tasks It also helps product managers manage their projects effectively create and manage product roadmaps user story maps and agile and Scrum methodologies
Miro is an excellent tool for collaborating and brainstorming with teams remotely Its vast canvas space extensive library of premade templates and userfriendly interface make it easy to create and share ideas visually I particularly like its realtime collaboration feature which allows team members to work together seamlessly regardless of their location Overall Miro is a robust and flexible tool that can be used for various purposes from project management to creative brainstorming sessions
Miros pricing structure could be seen as expensive especially if users only require a few of the advanced features Our enterprise license charges the same cost per user even if most staff only use it intermittently As power users our team gets great value from the product but the accountants just see 60 of the company using it a few times a month and complain loudly 
If using SSO shared boards often link to the online version rather than the native app and the constant signingin can become frustrating
Summary: Users appreciate FigJam for enabling remote whiteboarding sessions and seamless collaboration with colleagues, eliminating the need for physical office presence. However, they note that it requires an additional paid subscription separate from Figma.

Text:
The ability to have an interactive workshop online that is collaborative and impactful
I love that you can collaborate with everyone at the same time truly Building out the space for the collaboration is easy to do allowing it to be prepared ahead of time You can move between presentation mode and working mode quickly Miro has made my workshops much more interactive 
 
I love the builtin grouping and voting functionality These provide a level of quick feedback you often to do receive in collaboration tools
The number 1 item is dont count on everyone having received your invite to the board when you share If you need someone in a meeting you must have them validate prior that they have access Often I have invited people and then we have had to search for a way to get them in I think this happens if they have an account already in place 
 
There is also trouble with some of the functionality  you can CtrlV to paste but if you use the past from the menu often it doesnt work effectively also things come in very small and you may have to go in search of where they were pasted

Text:
Miro solve the problem of aligning people in a remote meeting and having a shared understanding of what needs to be achieved in the meeting It also provides a say to prepare strucutre of workshops that are engaging and self documenting
The speed and fluidity of the application makes you able to create concepts and structures on the fly as you are facilitating a meeting The added controls make for a great facilitator experience

It is providing a cloud based collaboration tool with multiple features within that can be of benefit to all type of roles within a team Downloading the board also helps share it with those who dont have access to it immediately
Its a very powerful tool for collaboration remotely across different teams Its whiteboard nature gives it the flexibility to use it the way you want Be it for project management or creating process flows 
The preexisting templates on Miro are also very useful for quick to do boards

Summary: Users find Figma beneficial for solving process issues, generating ideas, and collaborating between teams, especially during the pandemic. However, they find the licensing process tedious, as limited licenses restrict collaboration, forcing them to use personal email accounts for free versions and later transfer to paid versions to access all features.

Text:
Miro allows multiple users to simultaneously share ideas as visuals within the same space without disruption This feature makes it very helpful for any roadmap planning session A team can always return to a Miro board after to recap what has been shared or continue the work
I find Miro helpful in brainstorming sessions prototyping new digital products or mapping a flow chart It is easy to share and export a Miro file to different formats
I wouldnt say I like that there is no integration between Miro and Microsoft PowerPoint yet and I believe many users have raised the same request Since graphic and drawing tools on Miro are better we want to have the ability to work between the two platforms to present any idea better
Summary: Users find Miro valuable for enabling real-time collaboration among distributed teams and appreciate its adaptability for various meetings and workshops. They also like the continuous development of new features. However, some users may need basic training or resources to get accustomed to the navigation and features of the online whiteboarding tool.

I had a problem of trying to show someone the visual design that was in my head By using figjam and an addon to download examples of designs I was able to put together a mockup of a design to collaborate with my team and determine a solution that worked for us The prototype feature meant I was then able to present our mockups to the CEO acting as a functional website The presentation was a hit and we got approval to move forward with the changes
The amount of powerful features built into the free version is incredible Im using Figjam daily from mockups of new websites to even simple UI designs to send to our engineering team The ability to prototype a working design is amazing There are some crazy good addons that you can use to extend the program for insane timesaving benefits
It feels a bit overwhelming when you open it at first and sometimes things may behave unexpectedly because you might not realise one of the settings is enabled eg clip content for a frame

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement

Text:
Another problem that Miro solves is the challenge of sharing complex ideas in a simple way Miros range of templates diagrams and sticky notes make it easy to share ideas visually which can be especially helpful for projects that require a lot of detail or complexity This has allowed me to communicate my ideas more effectively with my team members resulting in better collaboration and a more efficient workflow
I have found Miro to be an incredibly powerful tool for collaborating with teams One of the things I like best about Miro is how easy it is to use The interface is intuitive and userfriendly making it simple to get started even for those who are not particularly techsavvy 
The realtime collaboration features in Miro are also incredibly helpful Multiple team members can work on a board simultaneously which helps to streamline the collaborative process and ensure that everyone is on the same page Additionally the platforms extensive range of features such as templates sticky notes and diagrams are highly customizable allowing for greater flexibility when working on projects
One thing that I have found to be a drawback of Miro is its pricing structure While the platform offers a free plan its more advanced features are only available with paid plans which may be expensive for smaller teams or individuals Additionally the platforms extensive range of features can be overwhelming for new users and it may take some time to learn how to use everything effectively However Miros support resources including video tutorials and a user community are quite helpful in getting up to speed quickly

Text:
Collaborating with people in different locations and timezones 
Repository  bringing multimedia assets related to a single project into one space 
Collaborating without a tool like this would be incredibly difficult
As a UX researcher Ive been using Miro for years It helped me collaborate remotely before the pandemic forced everyone to go remote Ive used it for project management research synthesis collaboration and feedback and even lightweight design The templates help save time when putting together something like a Gantt or Kanban board An absolute must for remove workshops love the timer background musing voting Follow me mode Very easy to learn
The UI has gotten a bit busy with controls in all 4 corners of the screen I supposed its expected for a tool that does so many jobs
Summary: User appreciates the ease of collaboration and sharing information with remote whiteboarding sessions facilitated by FigJam, and mentions that non-designers have started to adopt it in their workflows. They also suggest adding more visual options to the platform to create more customized and visually exciting files.

Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this

Miro is helping us work virtually and collaborate in a shared space in a flexible manner We are able to collaborate on mapping existing processes dynamic thought mapping by categories and a general shared space to easily collect thoughts and move them around quickly as the discussion evolves

The downsides Ive experienced with Miro is that it can be difficult to organize the boards youve contributed to or are actively participating in vs ones that youve previously contributed to and to separate them by categories I havent found a good way to categorize boards and so they all kind of land on my favorites or recent boards list and thats it then I just have the board names to use to find what Im looking for

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Found this thread helpful Share it with fellow indie makers and solopreneurs who could use these tips Lets support each other on our solo business journeys

Text:
Describe the problem your experiencing and how your idea helps solve this
When you create an autolayout frame it always defaults to 10px Many design systems call for an 8px grid and in many cases users dont want ANY padding especially where edgetoedge designs are concerned
Ask questions to bring the community into the conversation
What are everyones thoughts about the following solutions
Default autolayout padding based on the big nudge amount in your settings
Allow for tokenization of paddingmargin grids and offer up autolayout parameters based upon those tokens
Allow users to override the padding to 0px at the creation of the autolayout frame by using an alternative key command like ctrlshifta command on mac

Fastest way I found to apply auto layout with 0 paddings 
Select object  optioncmdG  shiftA
Actually even faster Select object  cmdG  shiftA

Text:
This app worked fine as a free user however after becoming a subscribed member I ran into some annoying and suspicious issues I wanted to utilize the AI to see where the limits were and then to eventually use it for academic and creative purposes Of course theres a limit to free uses so I subscribed to a month to see how often I would have to use this and if it was really worth paying for longer I paid 499 for the one month subscription but it wont actually let me use the AI and instead tells me that I need to subscribe but I already have The receipt is in my email as proof that I did pay
My app says I am a subscribed member so why is it denying me member benefits I have tried many things to fix this including restarting my phone restarting the app deleting and downloading the app again logging out and then back in etc Nothing has worked so far Not only do I feel robbed but it almost feels intentional because when I tried to use the AI before paying for a subscription I would only get a message saying that I have run out of free uses but after subscribing it sends me straight to the subscription choice page That gives the impression that the app is purposely not letting me use the AI program even though I have paid for it regardless of if that is actually the case or not Looking through some of the other lower reviews I am not the only one who has ran into this problem Please fix this because it is frustrating to not be able to use what I paid for
Summary I paid for premium but the app isnt letting me actually use premium benefits
Thank you Frustrated Notion User
Summary: User experienced issues with the app not allowing them to use the AI program after subscribing, despite having paid for it. They have tried multiple solutions, but none have worked. The user is frustrated and feels robbed, as they feel the app is intentionally not letting them use the AI program.

Text:
Dear NotionHQ
I recently obtained my certification from your platform and while I appreciate the knowledge and skills I gained from the experience I believe its time for a change in your testing methods
NotionHQ Were in 2023 and your current questionandanswer format feels outdated With the vast resources available to us online including Google Notion docs and ChatGPT its unnecessary to rely solely on memorization and rote learning
NotionHQ I suggest implementing a challenge or projectbased approach to make the tests more engaging and interesting Spending an hour answering questions only to fall short of the 70 passing mark feels like a waste of time and time is a valuable commodity for everyone
NotionHQ I understand that obtaining a certification is important but the current system doesnt seem to reflect the dynamic and innovative nature of your platform I hope youll consider updating your testing methods to keep up with the times

Text:
FigJam is the onestop shop for collaboration in my current team and many teams Ive been a part of in the past Its a our virtual whiteboard for lowfidelity ideation brainstorming and alignment activities
I use Figjam daily for all ranges of team collaboration  from rapid ideation to flow mapping and user research planning to facilitating product workshops Its a critical tool for a remotefirst environment and I always appreciate all the ongoing updates that add to usability performance and speed

Text:
Before Figma I had a hard time meeting up with customer requirements for Prototyping and Wireframing of mobile apps and web landing pages I was using Photoshop and it was quite tasking With Figma my designs are easier I complete them faster and I have access to more methods specifically meant for UIUX
It is not as restrictive as other design applications It is very free easy incorporation of external files that contribute to the general design and an interface that even a beginner can get around with ease
Requires a fast internet connection and saves all your work to the cloud so a stable internet connection is a must while working Cloud storage is an appreciable feature but offline functionality is a musthave feature as well
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for its ability to identify and articulate ideas, as well as its simple and easy-to-use online collaboration features. They particularly enjoy the brainstorming capabilities and integration of frames for storytelling. However, they find Miro expensive due to per-user licensing and would prefer the option to share read-only boards without consuming additional licenses.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters

Text:
We want to start using versioning in our projects and we are trying to figure out the best way to do it
The approach that makes more sense to us is to create a new branch on each file for the new version
Our issue is that we have team members working on each version 1 and 2 but we cant create a new feature branch for the version 2 branch we dont have this issue for version 1 because that is the main branch
Our question is if does exist an official way to work with different versions in the same file in order to handle versioning or if there is a better way to do this
Example of what we need
Button v1 branch main
a new feature for Button v1 a new branch from the main branch
Button v2 branch version 2 branch
a new feature for Button v2 a new branch from version 2 branch
The second question is how to handle major minor and patch updates into Figma following semantic versioning definition
Our idea is to handle major changes with branches and minorpatches with version history What do you think
There is a recommended way to handle versioning

Text:
Serving as a onestopshop for designing and planning an intensive leadership course delivering the course itself various group and individual activities will be performed in a Miro board team collaboration and content visualization
Nearly limitless toolset coupled with intuitive functionality plays nicely with links pasted and imported resources and videos allows you to dump organize and map all the various pieces of a vast or simple project offers amazing opportunities for team  group collaboration insanely useful tool not just for planning but for presentation as well  can also easily be leveraged as a FUN teaching tool New features and integrations are continually added so even if something isnt possible or easy now you can bet it will be added soon
While intuitive there can be a bit of a learning curve for new users for instance learning how to pull oneself across the board versus grabbing and moving board items Board owners must be thoughtful in locking or hiding items they dont want moved or deleted ahead of time to ensure visitors dont inadvertently mess up your masterpiece There are still some hardtoexplain quirks  for instance some URL links for whatever reason show up as just links when pasted whereas others show up as a summary snapshot of the resource
Summary: The user appreciates the ability to create Agile retrospectives, root cause analysis, and visualizing a road map, as well as the ability to interactively edit tasks in a schedule. They also appreciate the flexibility of the Miro template for Fishbone diagrams, but wish for a user-defined zoom percentage.

I get hung up on the UI sometimes as its a new way of navigating and pointclickdrag It just takes some getting used to The zooming in and out feature is also a little funky and I have not quite mastered the sizing for what ever I am trying to work on or design

Text: The app itself is so amazing that Im always thankful to use it very well However for users who work on documents and general tasks poor Bluetooth keyboard connectivity is too fatal Even if I try to type text from the iPad to the Bluetooth keyboard the cursor disappears and I cant write at all So in the end I have to use a separate laptop which is such a fatal flaw that makes my personal reason for buying an iPad and starting to use Notion come to nothing Please improve the Bluetooth keyboard connectivity By the way I mainly use Cyclones K3 model If only keyboard connectivity were improved it could be recognized as the best app that could not be expressed even with five stars The fact that I cant use an external keyboard is so decisive for me

Text:
Ive been looking for an app with the kind of capabilities notion has for sometime but was hesitant to download because of all the reviews relating to its poor performance on the iPad which is where I do most of my work but eventually decided to give it a go since most of the reviews I saw were at least a year old and I figured they might have sorted out the bugs in it by now
They have not Im writing this not 20 minutes after initially downloading and testing it out and its already very clear to me that it simply doesnt work This is only a matter of the interface which I would say is not super intuitive anyway  I could have overlooked that assuming I would get used to it with time  the very basics were not functional Its a battle to do even the simplest actions scrolling down the page selecting a template deleting and creating pages  all the things you rely on regardless of whether the interface is to your liking Was very willing to give this a good try before I disregarded it but I dont even see how that would be possible without risking all of my uni worknotes Definitely needs a rethink which is a shame because according to the reviews it works so well on laptopPC and is obviously very effective But this app is not conducive to working on an iPad which effectively renders the point of having a tool thats supposed to keep everything in one easily accessible place moot because if you use a tablet even if its not your main device you simply cant use it on there and so would either not be able to use your iPad anytime you wanted to make a note or would have to have two separate systems Would 100 give it another go if this problem is fixed but at the moment its just not working
Summary: User is disappointed with the app's performance on the iPad, as it is not intuitive and does not work as expected. They initially gave it a try but are now reconsidering their decision due to the issues they encountered. The user suggests a rethink and possible fixes to make the app more effective for iPad users.

Records for qualification learning are used with personal accounts so that records for qualification learning can be viewed on various devices but anyway shortcomings are conspicuous and difficult to use I dont recommend it at all as an app when you want to watch content across multiple devices

After adding AI to the function even if you try to insert a photo with the insertion function press  on the screen it will prioritize AI character input so it now takes about 1 minute to insert the photo The addition of the AI function was a real inconvenience and I can only think that it was added out of complacency Whats more you cant disable the AI function yourself
When I asked for a solution to such a complaint I received a notification that the AI function was disabled but it was not disabled at all and they were left alone and unable to respond to inquiries
Summary: User finds the app difficult to use due to its heavy character input and AI function, which takes too long to insert photos and prioritize AI character input. They also find it inconvenient that the AI function cannot be disabled.

Text:
Miro has the power to aggregate what has been shared among multiple tools In addition it has the potential to allow multiple people to work at the same time without any problems and it has been used in seminars and training sessions and has been very popular In the training that I participate in training using miro is increasing and it is very useful to visualize the result of the discussion in a short time
Miro is easier to use than an actual whiteboard In particular its easy to attach write move and connect sticky notes and it automatically corrects the connection lines so you can use it more efficiently than an actual whiteboard So you can focus on the discussion Also miro is great for sharing information you create online ensuring that the same image information is conveyed As a comparison to other similar tools its nice to have reaction features icons and formatting that you cant use up
The disadvantage of miro is that the access can be quite slow depending on the board When you first open a board with a lot of information on it you often have to wait a few 10 seconds I hope that this problem will be solved by devising means such as image processing centered on the area where the display priority is being determined Also if you just use it you dont have a chance to see new or useful functions so I think it would be good if you were shown it by a popup This feature may already exist and you may have turned it off yourself but it is true that it does not appear at this time
Summary: The user appreciates Figma for its ease of use in remote and hybrid teams, allowing for asynchronous problem-solving and accessible designs. However, they find the flow charting feature challenging when referencing other boards.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
Summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Figma is used for both our greyframes mediumfidelity layout documents as well as our final designs Its collaboration tools are second to none and clients love getting the upclose look at their products This really feels like a tool by web developers for web developers though I will admit that the recent acquisition by Adobe makes me pretty nervous
Figma is an excellent tool that forces a full paradigm shift for us designers With autolayout objects on the page flow freely down the page just like on the web Its a 99 complete implementation of flexbox in a design program Once youve gotten into the mindset shift of rows and columns everything on a web page is just a nested collection of either rows or columns you can use autolayout to position everything on your page and gone are the days of reflowing the entire comp because the length of the paragraph changed Looking at you Photoshop
The image manipulation tools are lacking An image is either an object which is fine or a background But there is no ability to set focal point on the backround or borrow some of the CSS coverconstrain background positions
Summary: Users find Figma helpful for remote collaboration, making their work more effective and efficient. They appreciate Miro's centralized file management, easy collaboration features, and numerous templates that provide structure to their research. Despite being slightly expensive, users believe it is worth the investment.

Text: Ive been using Notion for a couple of years and its one of the easiest and most comprehensive applications to use for notetaking on MacBooks Recently Ive switched to an iPad and the functionality has drastically deteriorated in my user experience which is concerning as the iPad is usually touted as a functional productivity device especially to students for notes The app often glitches the toolbar at the bottom for editing font often disappears while working on multiple tabs sometimes font colours dont show up on screen even after multiple tries Theres difficulty in moving blocks of text around on the screen for reordering sometimes especially when working with stage manager in the smallest preset window
Summary: User experienced issues with Notion on their iPad, such as glitches, disappearing toolbar, and difficulty in moving blocks of text around. They mentioned that the app is not as functional as it was on their MacBooks.

Text:
Over the past 6 months Ive been on the hunt for a new browser that can replace Chrome for me as a writer and product engineer And I found it

I was looking for 3 things from a new browser privacy performance and productivity After testing the usual suspects like Firefox Safari and Brave and trying out some new kids like KagiHQs Orion SigmaOS and browsercompanys Arc  I eventually switched to
KagiHQ SigmaOS browsercompany Arc by the browsercompany  You can read my full reasoning and review of all the browsers on my blog  but Arc has just completely stolen my heart 
KagiHQ SigmaOS browsercompany As a writer Arcs spaces and fullscreen workflow makes me feel so organized and focused when doing research and as an engineer it provides Chromes dev tools with some added feature sugar that makes it a joy for development work
KagiHQ SigmaOS browsercompany I highly recommend you join Arcs waitlist and try it out yourself And if you want to try it earlier DM me for a referall

Text:
FigJam lets me my allremote team and our stakeholders quickly and easily collaborate to collect and organize ideas Its incredibly simple and works well for people of all technical skillsets I use it for hours every day
FigJam is simple and flexible  my team and I have used it for everything from workflow diagramming to stakeholder workshops on product vision Weve also trained nondesigners to use the tool in under 2 minutes They love it and even use it when we arent around
The ability to collaborate with nonauthenticated users is incredible but resetting the 24hour timer is a bit tedious I understand there has to be some inconvenience to push for more paid accounts but I wish there was a way to extend those timers I also wish there was a vertical alignment option in the menu bar for moving text to the top or bottom of shapes in addition to horizontal alignment But other than small feature requests like this I have no complaints
Summary: User praises Miro as a comprehensive collaboration tool that is intuitive and easy to use, with a valuable freemium version. However, they find the account and security hierarchy confusing at times.

Text:
Currently when you test a prototype on a mobile device it will fit the prototype to the width of the testing device despite the fact the zoom mode is called Fit to screen or contain in the URL request param Which results in a bad experience when the prototype is designed in a higher aspect ratio than the device youre testing the prototype with Main CTAs placed on the bottom of the screen will appear underneath the fold for example
It would be ideal if you select Fit to screen the artboards will actually fit the screen So if the testing device has a less high aspect ratio than the artboard space will be added to the sides of the prototype And if the testing device has a higher aspect ratio than the artboard space will be added to the top and bottom of the prototype
The Fit width zoom mode can be used for the current behavior

Text:
I use Miro for mind maps team whiteboard sessions sprint and product retrospectives collaborative wireframing with Experience designers and could go on with this list It has application with a number of product management tasks
I use Miro for a long list of important product management activities It has a nice set of wireframing tools and is easy for someone who wants to sketch out ideas without using advanced design tools like Figma of Invision I also use it to collaborate with stakeholders within the company when framing problems The team there regularly makes product enhancements that make the tool even better
The organizational structure of the tool leaves a bit to be desired This may be user error more than anything but sometimes after creating several different boards on a similar topic its hard to organize them into a folder structure that makes it easy to find the board Im looking for
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for its easy navigation, customizable templates, and visually appealing interface. They find it effective for client meetings and project planning, and believe it fulfills its intended purpose without any significant weaknesses.

Text:
Miro gives a remote team a place to collaborate that is accessible on any device with internet access It has become as fast as writing notes by hand rather than the sometimes extensive startup required on other platforms Even rudimentary diagrams and sketches are easy to create in realtime There is an opportunity to have asynchronous discourse through the comments
It is extremely intuitive to get started as a new user It has become an essential tool for remote collaboration on my team of primarily visual thinkers It is easy to go from loose sticky note ideas to a full deliverable sketch or even the final deliverable in some cases The tool is so flexible we have had to apply some rigor as a team to use it consistently and get the most out of comments notes etc 
 
I love that the Miro team is always pushing updates and new features I also like the available training tools templates and frequent presentations hosted by Miro that feature Miro employees as well as outside users
The dislikes are more about features I wish were included such as better interoperability between Miro and Excel as well as data visualization capabilities I would like the ability to create vector symbolsshapes and add custom fonts I also wish that there were more features that catered to printed media  such as the ability to create paragraph styles and formatting templates with labels that could be adjusted on an instancebasis but still referred back to a primary layout
Summary: User finds Figjam easy to use and flexible for their needs in aligning key initiatives and brainstorming sessions. However, they face challenges in granting access to others and occasionally experience functionality issues.

Text:
Miro helps me work remotely and more efficiently It provides an online realtime workspace for my entire team that helps us collaborate efficiently no matter where were located
My favorite thing about Miro is how it simplifies remote collaboration with its comprehensive collection of features including collaboration text editing and visual effects It has an easy learning curve that allows all users to be up and running quickly with no more than a few minutes of training In addition I appreciate having access to the library of prebuilt templates that save me countless hours when coordinating geographically dispersed teams These benefits make Miro an industry standard for enabling effective communication between remote workers on collaborative projects
I find that the complexity of MIROs features can make it difficult to learn but once you understand its capabilities and features there is no limit to the tasks you can accomplish Although a free account does not have all the same options as a paid account  such as private boards  with careful collaboration between team members using different accounts your project will still be successful
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's ability to create beautiful CX artifacts and its features, usability, Miroverse, templates, and support. However, they find it pricey and suggest allowing free guest access for the first 24 hours.

After the most recent update of Figma  Pushed a couple of days ago prototypes using Figmas nested component prototyping have been affected This has been cross checked on web links  alternative machines

Text:
Using new tools to increase the academic workflow is good
However is there a risk of getting overwhelmed
Do you suffer from tech procrastination
AcademicChatter ThePhDPlace PhDVoice A  
Theres literature search tools note taking tools brainstorming tools editing tools time management tools citation tools tools linking among tools And new ones every day
They are good But do you need to use them all
No you dont
Should you try some of them
Sure
There is something like tech procrastination You can go down rabbit holes of tool use trying new ones listening to more YouTube tutorials subscribing to more newsletters
But in the end you still need to do the work as a researcher Nothing can replace thinking lab work
So try new things out and if it makes sense for you the way you work the way you think your topic your personal preferences  fine But you shouldnt feel like youre falling behind if youre not trying out every new thing out there
This is not antitech at all I love exploring new things But they really can be a distraction The FOMO is real They are time drains There are costs
So do your work Do your research And sample these new tools every once in a whilebut dont procrastinate with tech
mrillig Thats why I prefer tools like NotionHQ that combine almost all of them in one client AI tools Notetaking timemanagment etc

Text:
Ive been a designer for a little over 13 years Early in my design career I started feeling like I wanted a more technical role and switched to frontend development
I remember the exact moment that the concept of components and systems thinking clicked for me
At the time I was building custom WordPress themes 
Within my theme Id have a partials folder full of my silly little components
And I had my templates folder full of my silly little templates
Pulling components from my partials folder into my templates enabled me to have really modular maintainable and organised template files
Seeing it all come together was a huge aha moment for me but I didnt know why  at the time design systems wasnt a wellknown concept
I spent a tonne of time playing with Sass extending classes using mixins and all that fun CSS goodness

Looking back at it now I realise that what I was really kind of doing was implementing a simplified version of component properties
Code felt natural and intuitive  I loved the idea of having a bunch of components that I could pull from and iterate upon rapidly
I wanted to be able to replicate that workflow in design so badly But design tooling wasnt anywhere close to what it is now
Designing in Photoshop involved a tonne of manual copying pasting and replacing The process felt outdated and ineffective and often resulted in a tonne of inconsistencies
I dreamed of a tool that could reflect some of what we do in code even the tiniest bit
When I learned about Figma a few years later it felt like a huge weight had been lifted and my passion for design exploded
Im so grateful to be working at a time where technology is evolving so rapidly and some of the gaps between designdev are starting to thin out
This was a lot of tweets about nothing but I woke up feeling so in love with my career 
And just generally grateful that I get to sit around all day working on design systems architecting components crafting design patterns and collaborating with developers 
I dont think Id be so passionate about my career if figma didnt come around when it did  Its setting the standard of things to come and were only at the beginning

Text:
Miro allows us to work on projects concurrently with multiple users Collaboration sessions dont usually require users to take away update tasks The document gets updated during the collaboration session
I started using Miro when COVID hit and we started working from home We originally started using it as a simple whiteboard replacement As we became more familiar with the tool we saw its power as more than a whiteboard replacement
Miro is very comprehensive The comprehensiveness leads to frequent software updates It becomes a little irritating that whenever you open the software it prompts you to restart to download the updates
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's collaborative capabilities and initially used it as a whiteboard replacement during remote work. However, they find the frequent software updates irritating and disruptive to their workflow.

Text:
I primarily use FigJam to diagram site maps and content sections for websites
It is incredibly easy to quickly get ideas out onto a board I havent found a diagrammingwhiteboard tool that is as intuitive as FigJam
While it is extremely fast and userfriendly the types of content you can put into a FigJam board are somewhat limited
Summary: The user finds Miro extremely helpful for collaborating and presenting information across screens, especially in a remote working environment. They appreciate the ease of use and the ability to track information and review past discussions. They also appreciate the ability to use Miro on their computer and iPad Pro, but find the software buggy and slow on the iPad. They suggest using Freeform as an alternative to Miro in offline mode.

Text:
Collaboration tools are very important in this remote world that were living in FigJam provides our teams with a natural medium to collaborate with We love it for retrospectives group plannings brainstorming etc
FigJam makes it easy to collaborate with a team on a variety of different use cases From whiteboarding to retrospectives to planning meetings to organizing information
Because it is mostly unstructured you or your team is left to decide what structure works best for your use case
Summary: The product is helping the User to quickly analyse large amounts of data, identify correlations and gain new insights, all within a visually appealing format. Users appreciate the product's simplicity and intuitiveness, as well as its unlimited whiteboard space which is great for collaboration, forming new ideas, and making insights. The User finds that the product can become clunky when uploading multiple files, and some PDFs are difficult to read. Additionally, the User has to continually log in to their work account if it has been inactive for a short while.

Summary: Users find FigJam essential for remote communication, collaboration, and alignment, particularly in organizing and structuring UX research activities. However, they wish the Tables feature was more flexible for complex tasks.
